field.label: Handle Type
field.help: Select the handler type. In most cases, leaving this as "handle" will be the best choice.

field.label: Handle Path
field.help: Enter a handler like '/*' or '/example/*', or leave blank for a catch-all handler (recommended). You can define multiple handlers per domain/subdomain by creating additional entries. Save more specific handlers first, as the first matching handler is prioritized. Blank handlers are processed last automatically. To reorder, clone handlers in the desired sequence and delete old ones.

field.label: Description
field.help: Enter a description for this handler.

field.label: Domain
field.help: Select a reverse proxy domain to which this handler should be added.

field.label: Subdomain
field.help: Optionally, select a reverse proxy subdomain to which this handler should be added. In most cases, leaving this as "None" will be the best choice.

field.label: Upstream Domain
field.help: Enter the internal domain name or IP address of the upstream server destination for this handler.

field.label: Upstream Port
field.help: Enter the port number of the upstream server. Leave this empty for bind to port 80. For HTTPS, use 443.

field.label: Upstream Path
field.help: Enter a path prefix like '/guacamole' that should be prepended to the upstream request because the application demands it.

field.label: TLS
field.help: Use HTTP over TLS (HTTPS) to communicate with the Upstream Server. In most cases, leaving this unchecked will be the best choice. Caddy uses HTTP for communication with the Upstream Server by default.

field.label: NTLM
field.help: If "TLS" has been checked, check "NTLM" in addition for reverse proxying an Exchange Server. In most other cases, leaving this unchecked will be the best choice.

field.label: TLS Insecure Skip Verify
field.help: Turns off TLS handshake verification, making the connection insecure and vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks. Do not use in production.

field.label: TLS Trusted CA Certificate
field.help: If TLS is enabled, and you are not using a globally trusted server certificate on your Upstream Server, you can choose a CA certificate or self-signed certificate to trust from "System - Trust - Authorities".

field.label: TLS Server Name
field.help: Optionally, specify a hostname or IP address that matches the SAN of the "TLS Trusted CA Certificate". Please note that only SAN certificates are supported; CN will not work.
